frontmatter.description: Arrays work similarly to sets in math. It's a collection of elements, but arrays are ordered through an index. The index of an element in an array is just its position from the start starting from index 0.
frontmatter.title: Arrays

frontmatter.description: The difference between while and do while is that the code inside the scope { } of the loop is ran first before evaluating the condition.
frontmatter.title: Do While Loop

frontmatter.description: For loops are best used when looping a pre-determined amount of times or until a condition is met through iteration. Syntax: for (declaration; condition; increment) { code }
frontmatter.title: For Loop

frontmatter.description: While loops check the condition before proceeding with an iteration of the code inside its scope. Syntax: while (condition) { cout << "something"; }
frontmatter.title: While Loop
